conbody.p:
Well-structured maps help users find information quickly and form the basis for all navigation and linking. At , maps may be used to define an entire deliverable, as well as subparts for the deliverable. Use maps to:
Organize content into chapters or appendices
Organize related topics into single reusable units
Organize topics that all relate to a single user goal
Divide large sets of related information into smaller, more manageable units
Create a master glossary
Establish relationships between parent/child and sibling topics Temporary maps may also be built to send a set of topics to an editor or reviewer even if these topics will not be referenced together in the final deliverable.
